definition: canon/law/standard work of scholarship/literary quotation or allusion/ceremony/to be in charge of/to mortgage or pawn
Song and Yuan literary form based on vernacular folk stories
to make far-fetched claims (idiom)/to offer outlandish explanations
petty official charged with reporting back to the ruler on what people in a locality are talking about (old)/novel in the vernacular/fiction writer/novelist
classical story or quote from the literature/the story behind sth
to add parallels and interpretations (to a story etc)/to develop and embellish/to interpret (often in a strained manner)
anecdote/lost or apocryphal story about famous person
form of writing novels that comprise lots of poetry in the body of the text, popular in the Ming Dynasty
sth else/a separate matter/not the same thing/with different jobs (not colleagues)/a remarkable thing/sth special/an odd thing/sth strange or incomprehensible

notes on poetry, an essay genre consisting of informal commentary on poems and poets and their lives (old)/a genre of narrative literature interspersing prose with poetry, popular in the Tang and Song dynasties
to have no basis in fact (idiom)
